intro: Stenandriopsis buntingii, commonly known as the Bunting's stenandriopsis, is a rare and little-known plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes numerous species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
